poem:
Title: "The Chase of Chance"

The bait, gleaming in the promise's glow,
A siren call from the commerce, laying so low.
Much indeed, they shall glean,
From this gamble, not so clean.
Anonymity traded for a fleeting joy,
Innocence, the casual pawn, they employ.
Feasting on the hopeful, their appetite intact,
To the game of chance, we are thus compacted.
